actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:30 a.m. on April 23, 2024.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered by unanimous consent. S. Con. Res. 29 — "Providing for a correction in the enrollment of H.R. 815."
Mr. Diaz-Balart asked unanimous consent to take from the Speaker's table and consider.
Pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5, the Chair announced the Speaker's designation of the period from Saturday, April 20, 2024 through Sunday, April 28, 2024 as a "district work period."
Pursuant to H. Res. 1160, the Senate amendment to H.R. 815 is considered as agreed to with the amendment described in section 6 of H. Res. 1160.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 366
actions-list.actionItem: 58 (Roll no. 152).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 8034 — "Making emergency supplemental appropriations to respond to the situation in Israel and for related expenses for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 311
actions-list.actionItem: 112, 1 Present (Roll no. 151).

actions-list.header: On motion to recommit Failed by recorded vote: 88

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Mr. Roy moved to recommit to the Committee on Appropriations.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 8035.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Cammack amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 154
On agreeing to the Greene (GA) amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 71
On agreeing to the Spartz amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 105

actions-list.actionItem: The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 8035 — "Making emergency supplemental appropriations to respond to the situation in Ukraine and for related expenses for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 385
actions-list.actionItem: 34, 1 Present (Roll no. 146).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 8036 — "Making emergency supplemental appropriations for assistance for the Indo-Pacific region and for related expenses for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 360
actions-list.actionItem: 58 (Roll no. 145).
The House adopted the amendments en gross as agreed to by the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 8038.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Nunn (IA) amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 249

actions-list.actionItem: The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 8038 — "To authorize the President to impose certain sanctions with respect to Russia and Iran, and for other purposes."

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Failed by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 215

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 3602 — "To prohibit the intentional hindering of immigration, border, and customs controls, and for other purposes."

The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on motion to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 3602, as amended, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
Pursuant to clause 10 of rule 20, the yeas and nays are ordered. Further proceedings are postponed.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with 30 minutes of debate on H.R. 8034.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 8034, H.R. 8035, H.R. 8036 and H.R. 8038. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 8034 under a closed rule and H.R. 8035, H.R. 8036, and H.R. 8038 under a structured rule. Provides for 30 minutes of general debate and one motion recommit on each bill. Rule also provides that upon disposition of the bills under consideration, the House will be considered to have taken from the Speaker's table H.R. 815 and to have concurred in the Senate amendment with an amendment inserting the texts of all bills as passed by the House, if passed.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1160. H.R. 8034 — "Making emergency supplemental appropriations to respond to the situation in Israel and for related expenses for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes."
Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union rises leaving H.R. 8035 as unfinished business.
On motion that the committee rise Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Diaz-Balart moved that the committee rise.

At the conclusion of debate on the Cammack amendment No. 4, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the noes had prevailed. Mrs. Cammack demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1160, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Cammack amendment No. 4.
An amendment, offered by Mrs. Cammack,  numbered 4 printed in Part B of House Report 118-466 to eliminate all non-military funding related to Ukraine.

At the conclusion of debate on the Greene (GA) amendment No. 2, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the noes had prevailed. Ms. Greene (GA) demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1160, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Greene (GA) amendment No. 2.
An amendment, offered by Ms. Greene (GA),  numbered 2 printed in Part B of House Report 118-466 to reduce every dollar amount in the bill to zero.

At the conclusion of debate on the Spartz amendment No. 1, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the noes had prevailed. Mrs. Spartz demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1160, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Spartz amendment No. 1.
An amendment, offered by Mrs. Spartz,  numbered 1 printed in Part B of House Report 118-466 to strike sections 401, 402, 403, and 407.
The Committee of the Whole proceeded with 30 minutes of general debate on H.R. 8035.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Virginia Foxx to act as Chairwoman of the Committee.
House resolved itself into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union pursuant to H. Res. 1160 and Rule XVIII.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 8034, H.R. 8035, H.R. 8036 and H.R. 8038. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 8034 under a closed rule and H.R. 8035, H.R. 8036, and H.R. 8038 under a structured rule. Provides for 30 minutes of general debate and one motion recommit on each bill. Rule also provides that upon disposition of the bills under consideration, the House will be considered to have taken from the Speaker's table H.R. 815 and to have concurred in the Senate amendment with an amendment inserting the texts of all bills as passed by the House, if passed.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1160. H.R. 8035 — "Making emergency supplemental appropriations to respond to the situation in Ukraine and for related expenses for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes."
Pursuant to clause 10 of rule 20, the yeas and nays are ordered. Further proceedings are postponed.
On agreeing to the Issa amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
The previous question was ordered on the amendment (A001) and the bill pursuant to the rule.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1160, the House proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Issa amendment No. 1.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Issa,  numbered 1 printed in Part C of House Report 118-466 to increase and decrease FMF to express support for the Philippines.
The House proceeded with 30 minutes of debate on H.R. 8036.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 8034, H.R. 8035, H.R. 8036 and H.R. 8038. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 8034 under a closed rule and H.R. 8035, H.R. 8036, and H.R. 8038 under a structured rule. Provides for 30 minutes of general debate and one motion recommit on each bill. Rule also provides that upon disposition of the bills under consideration, the House will be considered to have taken from the Speaker's table H.R. 815 and to have concurred in the Senate amendment with an amendment inserting the texts of all bills as passed by the House, if passed.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1160. H.R. 8036 — "Making emergency supplemental appropriations for assistance for the Indo-Pacific region and for related expenses for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes."
Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union rises leaving H.R. 8038 as unfinished business.
On motion that the committee rise Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. McCaul moved that the committee rise.

At the conclusion of debate on the Nunn (IA) amendment No. 2, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Meeks demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1160, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Nunn (IA) amendment No. 2.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Nunn (IA),  numbered 2 printed in Part D of House Report 118-466 to require the Treasury Department to report and brief Congress identifying all assets of the Iranian Government or covered persons valued at more than $5 million and requires a list of all licenses, statements of licensing policy, action letters, and all other sanction exemptions relating to Iran.
On agreeing to the Gimenez amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1160, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Gimenez amendment No. 1.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Gimenez,  numbered 1 printed in Part D of House Report 118-466 to require the annual China Military Power report to provide an assessment of the country's development in critical and emerging technologies and identify key China entities involved in each technology sector.
The Committee of the Whole proceeded with 30 minutes of general debate on H.R. 8038.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Virginia Foxx to act as Chairwoman of the Committee.
House resolved itself into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union pursuant to H. Res. 1160 and Rule XVIII.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 8034, H.R. 8035, H.R. 8036 and H.R. 8038. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 8034 under a closed rule and H.R. 8035, H.R. 8036, and H.R. 8038 under a structured rule. Provides for 30 minutes of general debate and one motion recommit on each bill. Rule also provides that upon disposition of the bills under consideration, the House will be considered to have taken from the Speaker's table H.R. 815 and to have concurred in the Senate amendment with an amendment inserting the texts of all bills as passed by the House, if passed.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1160. H.R. 8038 — "To authorize the President to impose certain sanctions with respect to Russia and Iran, and for other purposes."

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on April 20, 2024, at 12:54 a.m.: That the Senate passed H.R. 7888.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on April 19, 2024, at 2:00 p.m.: That the Senate passed S. 2958, agreed to S. Res. 655, and passed H.R. 4389.
The Chair designated Mr. Pallone to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Virginia Foxx to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
